standard_metadata.standard_description: Verify experimentally the properties of rotations, reflections, and translations:

question.content: **Draw the image of $\triangle ABC$ under a translation by $3$ units to the right and $4$ units down.**

hints.content: To translate $\triangle ABC$ by $3$ units to the right and $4$ units down, we basically translate $\triangle ABC$'s vertices and connect them.
For example, point $\blueD{B(3,2)}$ is translated to $\greenD{(6,-2)}$.    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A coordinate plane with a triangle having vertices A at zero, negative one, B at three, two, and C at two, negative three. The x- and y- axes scale by one. A dashed line moves three units right from vertex B and four units down to a point at six, negative two.

hints.content: Doing this for all vertices and connecting them, we get the following mapping:    [[☃ image 1]]

images.alt: A coordinate plane with a triangle having vertices A at zero, negative one, B at three, two, and C at two, negative three. The x- and y- axes scale by one.                                                                                                                               A dashed line moves three units right and four units down from all three vertices to show the corresponding vertices of a new triangle with vertices at six, negative two, three, negative five, and five, negative seven.
